message.content:
Context (previous statements or text):
The Winter Olympics have been hosted on three continents by twelve different countries. The United States has hosted the Winter Olympic Games four times, in 1932, 1960, 1980, and 2002. Lake Placid, New York, hosted the first Winter Games in North America in 1932 and again in 1980, making it one of two cities to host the event twice, alongside St. Moritz, Switzerland. Africa remains one of the continents that has not yet hosted a Winter Olympic event. France has hosted the Winter Olympics on three occasions, in 1924, 1968, and 1992. Germany (Garmisch-Partenkirchen), Yugoslavia (Sarajevo), and Russia (Sochi) have each hosted the games once. St. Moritz, Switzerland, has hosted twice in 1928 and 1948, while Innsbruck, Austria, hosted in 1964 and 1976.

Current statement to verify:
and twice each in austria (1964, 1976), canada (1988, 2010), japan (1972, 1998), italy (1956, 2006), norway (1952, 1994), and switzerland (1928, 1948). also, the games have been held just once each in germany (1936), yugoslavia (1984), russia (2014) and south korea (2018). the last time the usa hosted the winter olympics was in 2002. the ioc has selected beijing, china, to host the 2022 winter olympics and the host of the 2026 winter olympics will be selected in september 2019. as of 2018, no city in the southern hemisphere has applied to host the cold-weather-dependent winter olympics, which are held in february at the height of the southern hemisphere summer.

1. Which countries have hosted the Winter Olympics twice according to the statement, and can you provide the specific years in which these events took place?
2. When did the Winter Olympics take place in South Korea as mentioned in the statement, and which city hosted the event?
3. What was the most recent Winter Olympics hosted in Russia, and in which year did it take place, as stated?
4. According to the current statement, when was the last time the United States hosted the Winter Olympics, and which city hosted the event?
